comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: This is William C. Gorgas; Bain's photo caption omits his first name. Gorgas was a U. S. Army General, and a military surgeon. Why doesn't Bain call him "General Gorgas," or "Dr. Gorgas?" Gorgas instituted mosquito eradication in Havana during the Spanish American War, and later in the Panama Canal Zone during construction of the canal -- measures that eliminated the scourge of Yellow Fever in those places. history.amedd.army.mil/surgeongenerals/W_Gorgas.html Gorgas receives an honorary degree at Columbia University, June 4, 1913: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3389737397/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
